string.text: Listen, what kind of business you do have with the ecologists?

What? What ecologists, who are you? Ecologists and Duty are our worst enemies! We cut them to pieces! We... uh... y-you know... ? Only - shh! Hush... Do not beat me... do not... you'll be in big trouble!..
Oh, Sakharov spoke about a drunkard... who will trade a cool weapon for a box of vodka.
My "Stormbreaker"! Wh-where is it? Have you seen it?
Is it lightweight, with an extended magazine, cool optics and a silencer?
Yes, yes!
No, I haven't seen it...
Damn... I managed to lose it... It's all these voices... In my head, haunting me... Here... Again... Hey, bring me some vodka! Be a friend!
What's in it for me?

Damn, Marked One! I've already sobered up! Can't you help a man for free, once in your life? Oh, okay... I'm hearing you... The only thing that I can give you, is the leftover ammunition from my "Stormbreaker"... Anyway, I need it any more... bring me ten bottles will - and I'll pay you!
Okay. I'm on my way.
No, I don't feel like trudging across the Zone for your vodka.
Here's your fire-water as ordered. 10 bottles.
Thank you Marked One, you saved me... Anything to get drunk and forget... Take your cartridges...
Look, don't overdo it. Overcome this drunkenness!
Yes, I have your gun.
Listen, Marked One, return, and... I'll pay you whatever you want!
What do you have?
Well, look, you choose...
Artifacts.
Weapons.
Money.
Perhaps, I'll keep it.
Here, take it. I was keeping this stash for a rainy day... \nThank you for coming to my aid.
It's a pity... \nWell, well, your right, of course...
What do you want?
I'm looking for the leader of Freedom. I've got extremely important information for him.
Oh, and just how important is it?
I came across a group of Duty members not far from your base.

Uh-oh... Looks like Duty is trying to equalize again... Okay, you can enter, but make sure to put that piece away. Don't even think of making a mess in here, or you'll be leaving soon with your feet foremost.
OK.
Good afternoon.
Uh-huh!
Meaning?
Sure thing.
What's so funny?
Hey, man! Good to see you!
Hello.
Long time no see!
Have we met before?
Errrr.... Yeah! He-he...
To be honest, I can't seem to recall who you are.
Hmm... Yeah, it's fine, no problem.
What is this place, anyway?
This place... a nice little place... It's just a normal place, you know... just some people making a living, he he...
So what?
Pf-ft... You're asking some tough questions, Mr. Stranger!
And what if you cut to the chase?
Hey, relax! Hold on... well... it's just a normal place! A quiet one. All good all around. Yeah...you relax, alight? Don't get all worked up...
And who might you be?
Me?
Exactly. You. Not me.

Ha-ha, that's a good one! Me... What about me? I'm fine... Well, I... I make food... So, there. I'm a chef! The master of slices and spices! You know - parsley, dill, herbs, stuff like that... Bread, too... Right?
Got it.
Also, tinned foods... condensed milk with sugar... ham in a can... roast beef with tomato dressing... yeah...
I got it.
French bread... ketchup... eggs... brown bread... cheese, what have you. Wienies, too! And sausages! Fowl... cold, not flying.
OK, fine, I understand! Tell me your name at least.

Huh?.. Oh! Slavik is my name... that's just a label... No! It's an apron! I've got this white apron... Hey, look... Sit down, don't be a target... 'Cause, that sniper, you know... pick you off! .. They're, you know... They're like that...
Isn't there a village nearby?
Well...
Well, what?
Eh?
A village.
Aha... There is something. Some food there... condensed milk for one...
How do I get there?
Eh? Wait. Let me think... Nah, look, do you really need all that? Relax... Sit... Let's sit and have a smoke, OK?
I need to get to the village.
Alright... we just sit here, have a smoke.. Then we go... I'll take you there. No problem.
Don't go to all that trouble. Just tell me how to get there.
Sure... Hey, you're really challenging me here! We'll go there together in just a sec. First we just sit down, OK, and...
Listen, would you know where I can get some equipment?
Equipment? That's some code-speak to me, bro!
Equipment. Weapons. Artifacts.
Weapons... no... my knife... Want my knife? No? Yeah... Artifacts. What the hell for? Take it easy. C'mon, sit. Light one up with me. Let's talk... about artifacts...
Where can I find artifacts in this area?

That's easy! artifacts... We got artifacts up to our ears! You know the radioactive swamp? No? Doesn’t matter. It's there. I mean, the artifacts. Are there. You just stop flapping about. Take it easy. Eh? Artifacts... he-he-he... artifacts-shmartifacts...
OK. Take care.
Sure... sit down though, you're already here.
I'm leaving.
Eh? Sure thing... relax... OK? Close the door behind me, I'm leaving... ta-da-da-da...
Come, sit down! We'll have a good time...
Let's have a drink, why don't we?
Sure thing, bro! Pour it!
Well, well... Cheers!
Yes, that was a good one! Hold the bottle... there's some more left.
So, how about one more?
Ahhhh... awesome! Too bad the bottle's been taken care off already. Got some more?
Let me see.
Yeah, here! Hold your shot steady.
He-he... that was neat! A new one right out of nowhere. You got a warehouse full of them or what?
You, umm... Go ahead, drink. I haven't had much practice lately.
To our victory! Yeaaahh... Ah, good times, good times!
Yes... to our victory!
C'mon, come on, let's do another one... You got an... an-n-nother one, huh?
Let me look...
OK... this will be the last one, alright?... That's all I can handle tonight...
Give it h-h-h-eee... hheere!
Whoa... look at you... Did you drink all of that on your own?...
Hic! Tha-a-at, bro, is the bbb... bottom! Mmm... Hhhhhm...
I heard something about Freedom having an M202. Sure would be fun to take a look at that baby.
What are you getting at, man? You want me to... to give you... to spill the guts?.. What kind of fool do you take me for?
Calm down. I didn't know it was that serious.
You don't go snooping around for our weapons, got that? Who the hell are you, anyway? I've never seen you before!
Hey, come on! I only asked a question...
Tsss! Be careful with it, alright?
Done deal.
I, umm... ahem... I heard you guys got a M202... All I wanna do is just take a look at it, huh? Just get a glimpse of it... what do you say? Just a real quick look...
What?... You, umm... go to... ah, hell, what was it... I forgot! What were you asking about?
Grrr...great... grant... damn! flame... thrower... I'd like to... see it!
Nah... that you can't... anything you want, friend, but not that... No can do!
Umm, Ok... I, umm... didn't mean anything by it! Just asking...
Hic! M202, huh?
W-what?.. Oh! Well, it... it's in the village! We actually had... two of 'em... but those... r-retards! They lost it... wasted it!
Re-really? Wow, those... m-morons...
Hello, brother. I'm a Duty member and we're here on a mission. Would you like to join us?
Not particularly interested.
Then get our of way... loner.
I'm up for it.

Excellent. There, behind that hill, is the main breeding ground of those bastards - the "Free" ones - and me and my boys are going to stir it up properly. There's just one little problem. The base has only one entrance and it is well guarded. We thought of busting a hole in the fence, but their sniper in the tower won't let us. I don't want to send my guys to catch his bullets... but you - he'll let you come close and definitely won't shoot on sight. If you take him out, we'll owe you. Plus, if it goes as planned, you'll be able to take any equipment at the base, whatever you want.
Go on.
I've already told you: all you need to do is knock off the sniper at that tower above the fence. So, what do you say?
No, I'm not ready yet.
Then get out of the way.
I'll try.
That's great! As soon as you take him out, we'll start the fireworks.
There's one small problem. Since the base has only one entrance, a well-guarded one at that, we quickly thought of making another one, but...
But what?
I sent my guy at night to blow a hole in the fence. Well, either their sniper is too good or it just wasn't our day, but my guy went down. Now the dynamite is on the fence, but we can't blow it up.
Why?
I don't want to send my boys under that asshole's bullets, but you stand a great chance of taking him out. He won't shoot you on sight for sure. What do you say?
How much will I get?

Now that's talking business. 2000 from us for the sniper, plus a whole lot of gear at the base. Lots of a dead bodies there, I can promise you that. So, you can help us and help yourself. How about it?
Deal.
Good luck.
First I have to see how it all looks, then I'll tell you.
We'll wait. But not for long.
Thanks for your help, Marked One. Here is your reward.
Thank you.
We made a deal, didn't we?
So, you knocked off the sniper. Here's your fair compensation.
Gotcha.
Step aside, will you? We need to get ready...
OK.
Some other time.
Do as you will.
See you.
Shall we continue?
What exactly?
Thank you.

We're about to blow up the fence and get the party going. I can see you're a good shooter - maybe you could take care of the tower snipers? With snipers out of the way, we'll have an easier time getting to that shit head Lukash.
Did you knock off the sniper?
Yes.
Great work! Cleared the road for us... Here's a little something for your troubles.
Thank you.
What do I have to do?
Take care of the other snipers while we deal with these bastards. I can see you're good at that kind of thing.
Some other time.
Well, judge for yourself. I won't make you.
Deal.
There we go, great.
Don't interfere, Marked One.
OK.
Keep along your way.
OK.
What now?
Nothing.
Three assholes down, just like that! You came just in time: didn't blow our cover and came out safe and sound. By the way, I think no one has to know about this, eh?
I don't think so.
Perfect. Are you looking for a way to earn some dough, stalker?
Difficult to say.
What, you don't feel like living anymore?
No.
Something like that.
Maybe.
Then follow us, talk to our commander.
Commander?
Sure. Skull will tell you everything himself.
OK.

What's up, stalker! You're just in time. We're defending against "Monolith" jerks, and the next wave is about to arrive! Believe it or not, we just had our last sniper knocked off! Can you help? We'll pay back after the fight - you won't be sorry!
No, I cannot help you.
That's too bad. Come back if you change your mind.
I will.
Great! Go to the tower, there's a sniper rifle and a bunch of ammo. Pick them off from above and don't come down, or you run the risk of getting it from our own guys. Is the assignment clear?
As clean as a whistle.

As it should be. I hope to talk to you in the morning. Oh, and don't walk off too far... Or I might think you've decided to run off. And that would mean you-know-what, so keep that in mind! Now, assume your position.
That's right. OK, let's get to work. A "Monolith" group might be trying to break through here. That means it's gonna get hot real soon.
Got it.
You're right. I hope they won't be too many...
Where is my place?
Go to the tower, there's a Dragunov and some ammo. You'll be able to pick them off from above, but don't come down - watch out for our own bullets. Is the assignment clear?
Yes.
Stake out your own spot 'cause later you won't have time!
Looks like we took them all down. I say that's enough for today. Thanks for your help! Here, take this - a little bit of money to cheer you up.
Thank you.
Good luck, Marked One!
Hey, Marked One! Did Lukash send you?
Yes. He asked me to help you.

You're just in time. We're fending off "Monolith" jerks, and the next wave is almost here! Believe it or not, we just had our last sniper knocked off! Can you help? We'll pay back after the fight - you won't be sorry!
Looks like we took them all down. I say that's enough for today. Thanks for your help! Here, take this - a little bit of money to cheer you up.
Thank you.
Good luck, Marked One.
What's this place?
I'll be sure to visit him.
Oh, Marked One, what a guy, man, I will be eternally grateful to you, this is fucking great! Go back to Lukash, I just notified him on the radio you brought the BTR, he wants to thank you in person.
Well, it's yours from the commander.
No kidding, Marked One. No, I understand everything you're saying but that man is impossibly harsh, but if it's true... I'll be fucked! I'm stunned! Guys! Look what Marked One brought us!
Well, yes. The BTR has a "Guardian" automated perimeter security system. Lukash gave me the task to get this one for you, to reinforce the Barrier.
Mmm... no shit... this... damn, is it for us?
I've brought a gift, Cap! A BTR to reinforce the Barrier has arrived.
Hello, stalker!
We call it the Barrier... that's what it basically is. It's about the last normal outpost this side of the Zone's centre. It's a sort of buffer, you know, between the people and the Wild Territory.
What is there beyond it?

Only death... or serving "Monolith". "Our "Monolith"! In your name we..." Damn! In short, no one needs to go there. That's why we're based here, trying to prevent the muck from infesting the Zone. Like some kind of Jedi's, he-he. We also detain the really stupid ones - or at least try not to let them creep into the centre.
Why do you do that?

Who else but us? Duty? They are the shit when it comes to eradicating monsters and eliminating unwanted stalkers, but you should try some time to make them actually do something useful! Do you see them here? No? That's what I mean. We, on the other hand, do not aim to destroy the creatures that live here. A barrier, a normal barrier - that should be enough. As long as no side crosses the line...
And what if someone does?
Anything can happen. Anything. I don't want to...
Halt! Access to the arsenal is restricted to Freedom members only.
There, now you can enter the arsenal. Except there's a little problem...
What problem?
Don't sweat it, it's nothing terrible. The lock is jammed, that's all. If you really can't wait, just shoot it to pieces, I'll replace it later.
I see.
Skinflint sent me here to clear off the bloodsuckers.
So, stalker, what brought you to this sinister place? My advice is run for your life before it's too late!

Aha, now that's another matter... Hell knows what's going on here! A couple of our folks went into the village and never came back. Heck, we're not keen on dying yet! We're sitting here, deciding what to do next.
Hey, bro, way to freak out last night!
Meaning?

We were just sitting around and then you barge in piss drunk! And you barge right into the village, right into those bloodsuckers! Good thing we were there to put some brakes on you and make you sleep it off.
And what are you doing here?
Hell knows what's going on here! A couple of our folks went into the village and never came back. Heck, we're not keen on dying yet! We're sitting here, deciding what to do next.
Did you see the bloodsuckers?
So? How did it go?
I got rid of them.
Wow! You rock! Heck, you came out alive, so the next round of drinks is on you!
Thank you.

No. Our guys were supposed to go to the old water tower; that's probably where they went down. Well, if you made a deal with Skinflint, go there and check it out... Write down an address, will you? We'll write to your family if something goes wrong.
Why are you wandering around like a ghost?
Just looking around.
Seems to me you're too kind... OK, I'll go.
What brought you here?
Just looking around.
Was this the best place you could find? This is probably the shittiest spot in the whole Zone...
What's so bad about this place?

Hell knows what's going on here! Looks like the village is now home to a swarm of bloodsuckers. A couple of our folks went into the village and never came back. Heck, we're not keen on dying yet! We're sitting here, deciding what to do next.
So, you're not sure yourself?

Right on! If you have nothing else to do and your head isn't working right, you're welcome to take a stroll through the village. If you clear off those critters, Skinflint will surely shell something out for you. Write down an address, will you? We'll write to your family if something goes wrong.
OK, I'll go check it out.
You didn't go through the village, did you?
Yes.
A couple of our folks went there and didn't come back. Did you happen to see them?
No, I didn't. Just a few corpses on the ground.
Did you see bloodsuckers?
Yep. Go ahead and look for yourself, it's safe now - I mowed them down.
Wow! That's a trick! Know what... go see Skinflint at our base. He pays for good work.
OK, I'll go check it out.
So? How did it go?
I slaughtered those beasts.
Wow, you showed them! Know what... go see Skinflint at our base. He pays for good work.
I will.
OK, whatever...
What brought you here?
Just looking around...
Was this the best place you could find? This is probably the shittiest spot in the whole Zone...
What's so bad about this place?
Ah, hell knows. Looks like bloodsuckers have settled down in the village. A couple of our folks went into the village and never came back. Heck, we're not keen on dying yet!
So, you're not sure yourself?

Right on! If you have nothing else to do and your head isn't working right, you're welcome to take a stroll through the village. If you clear off those critters, Skinflint will surely shell something out for you. Write down an address, will you? We'll write to your family if something goes wrong.
OK, I'll go check it out.
So? How did it go?
I slaughtered those beasts.
Wow, that was awesome! My congratulations! And the best thing is, you're still alive...
Thank you.
Thank you. I'm happy to help.

I know, Cap has told over the radio. He's as happy as a kid with a new toy, he's almost dancing. Well done, Marked One. You're a great guy. Just as I promised, here's something I prepared for you from our reserves. It should really help when you hike to the Radar. A couple of artifacts to protect you from impact and psi and a machine gun, also Skinflint and Screw slightly altered a military suit in their spare time. They welded together a "Knight" exoskeleton with "SKAT" body armour, now you have the best of both. It turned out great, almost like tank armour, the only thing is, they can't be separated. This suit will protect you very well.
Lukash, the job is done. The Barrier is now reinforced with a BTR.
Oh, it's you, Marked One.
Lukash, can I help you with something?
Listen, I'm quite busy right now...
Um, Lukash... well, that didn't work out for me at the Barrier.
Damn you, Lukash, where are you sent was fucking hell...
We repulsed the attack on the Barrier.
Lucas, this is about the Barrier...
Lukash, I failed to complete the "snitch" task, but I helped Cap at the Barrier.
I failed your job regarding the "snitch".
Do you have some work for me?
Lucas, I solved your problem with the snitch.
Mmm, Lukash, about the "snitch"...
We dealt with the group at the abandoned farm.
Lukash, about Duty...
Hello, are you Lukash, the leader of Freedom?
Lukash, do you still have some important work for me?
How are you doing here at the Barrier?
So-so. Would it be too far-fetched to ask you to help us get a BTR for the Barrier? Our situation is not getting any better, if you can - help us.
Since you helped our guys at the Barrier, you can count on getting some rest on our territory, as well as our help. Oh, and my personal appreciation - a bit of legal tender for you...
I can't right now, I am not ready to go there yet.
Well, I'll try of course, but I can't promise what will happen.

That's all we can do, but at least its has some merit to strengthen the Barrier. If you do it - you will be well rewarded, you're going to the Radar next? So, I will outfit you like a tank, I give you my word, it will be first class. Before you leave - be sure to consult with Screw, he'll explain to you any nuances about this BTR, and what you would need to get it running.
That's the damn task, wow!

We intercepted their radio chatter and realized they ditched the BTRs and requested evacuation. A Chinook heavy transport helicopter was dispatched. But it never left the Dead City - whether they were picked up or not and what happened, is not clear. It probably crashed. Basically, Marked One, I want you to go there and look for the expedition's BTRs, find one at least and inspect in what condition it's in. Perhaps it will be in a decent enough state to bring it here. Then we would be able to put it to good use defending the Barrier - you must understand, this autonomous fighting vehicle would help us very much there, as well as preserving lives. If you find a suitable one, but it won't run - talk with Screw, he will help you to bring it to at least a drivable state.
Wow, judging by what you just described it is simply some sort of killing machine.

This model is not the regular BTR. These machines are BTR bodies mounted on Kharkov tractor chassis. These machines are virtually autonomous combat systems, operated by one or two people. They are equipped with special absorbers for deployment in anomalous fields, and are heavily armoured. The crew sits in a reinforced capsule and view the outside exclusively through a camera lens. The machine is equipped with a powerful on-board computer and an electronic guidance system with target acquisition which is designed specifically for the Zone. Recently these machines have had guidance system upgrades to fully automate them - allowing the crew to concentrate on driving without the need to acquire and fire at targets. This model is based on the original amphibious BTR which was crewed by four people.
Not really, please explain.

Well - about a couple of weeks ago, the military tried to mount another expedition to the Dead City but had to abandon it. They were seriously equipped. The expedition was backed up with a few "Guardian Class" BTRs, you're familiar with this equipment, yes?
Lukash, you don't expect me to go to the Radar to get you a tank?

Judging by the way "Monolith" keep trying to break through the Barrier, we need to improve the situation in some way, especially as we have few fighters. It's necessary to strengthen the Barrier, and to strengthen it properly. For this we need - an armoured vehicle...
What is it??
Well, generally speaking, Marked One, I have one more difficult, but necessary task for you. I'm not sure you can handle it, but if you do, I will be very grateful.
Hey, stalker. What do you need?
Nothing much, really.
Then let's get out of here, OK? Time is money.
I saw a group of Duty members in a farmstead near your base. About eight men, well equipped.
Why the hell did you split from the Barrier? Get out of here and don't let me catch sight of you near my base ever again.

Damn, these punks just won't settle down! Fine, we'll have to teach them a lesson. Hey, stalker, want to help us for a reward? Talk to Max, our chief. You two will get a crew together and root out those suckers.
OK.
Good luck, stalker.
I've already dealt with them.
So, you didn't handle the snitch business and failed at the Barrier, too? Get lost from my base and don't ever show up again!
For real? How many of them did you say there were?
Eight men.

You're a speedy one, stalker... OK, so, do you mind helping us out with something else? I'm ashamed to admit that there's a snitch among us. His name is Pavlik. He's leaking valuable info and that must be stopped.
In what way?
You must follow him to the farmstead and discover whose rat he is. He doesn't know you and isn't aware of our conversation either, so...
You think I have work for you to do?
Perhaps.

We've learned there's a rat in our midst, by the name of Pavlik. He's leaking valuable information. We know that for a fact, but don't have proof. Your task is to spy him out and discover who he is singing for. I think he's going to a meet tonight. You'll follow him quietly. Just be careful that he doesn't see you - he's extremely cautious. After you find out the identity of his connection, bump him off and the other guy, too, for good measure.
I'll do it.

We've learned there's a rat in our midst, by the name of Pavlik. He's leaking valuable information. We know that for a fact, but don't have proof. Your task is to spy him out and discover who he is singing for. I think he's going to a meet tonight. You'll follow him quietly. Just be careful that he doesn't see you - he's extremely cautious. After you find out the identity of his connection, bump him off and the other guy, too, for good measure.
No, not now.
There's one thing I wanted to ask you about.
He just left, so you'll have to catch up with him. Remember: you can and should bump him off, but only after he's exposed the agent he's ratting to. You'll have to eliminate the other guy, too.
Got it.
I told you to go talk to Max.
So, the assignment is complete... Good, good. I've got another one for you!
Hmm... What is it?
Sadly, I have to admit there's a snitch in our ranks. His name is Pavlik. He's leaking valuable information, and that must be stopped.

Exactly. And I think he will go to his meet some time between 10 and 11 p.m. It's going to be dark enough, so no one sees him, but the night time mutants won't be out yet. Go forth, stalker. After you're done, you will become a member of our group. Remember, you must catch the snitch red-handed! You've got to take him down during his meet, otherwise the mission will have failed.
You're still here?

Great job, Marked One! Here, take this... your payment for taking care of the snitch. You're welcome to rest on our territory whenever you want and you can also count on our help. Only, there's one more business I'd like you to do for me. Are you not too tired?
What exactly?
If you feel up to it, go to the outpost near the Red Forest exit. We've had reports claiming that either mutants or "Monolith" are planning a new attempt to break through there. The guys need help.
Well, you did help the guys at the Barrier, so - relax.
Relax. There's no work right now.
Yeah, you screwed up that mission... that sucks. Still, there's always another chance!
What chance?

Certain things point to the fact that very soon "Monolith" is going to try to break through from the Red Forest side. You gotta go see Cap - he's the commander at the Barrier - and see if he needs any help. Well, it's pretty obvious he does, really...
OK, I'll do it.
No, I won't do it yet.
Think about our guys, they're going to get wasted! You see, there's no one else but you that I can send... nobody.
You failed the mission, so we might as well kiss those documents good-bye. We have no use for losers like you.
Well, you screwed up that mission... that sucks. Still, you did help the guys at the Barrier; heck - you can relax on our territory. In case something comes up, we'll help you.
Got any work?
Not right now.
I've told you - go to the Barrier.
We'll talk after we take down those Duty assholes.
OK.
Lukash said that you'll do. Did you see those... at the farmstead?
No.
Hell... Duty's got something up their ass again! Oh well. Come with us, will you?
OK.
Yes.
Are there many of them?
Can't say for sure. I don't think there's too many.
About six to eight people. Reasonably equipped.
Go to Lukash.
Got any questions?
Yes. Lukash told me to intercept the Duty courier on the way from Red Forest to the Dead City. Could you tell me the best place to do that?

Hmm. Best thing would be to catch him before he reaches the farmstead near the passage to Dead City. Reinforcements are sure to be waiting for him there, so you'd have trouble dealing with them all. Plus, that way you'd have to pass through the village, which is a bad thing. Better go East of the village, and fast.
What's there in the village?
Believe me - not a single good thing. Lots of monsters roaming about, and anomalies, too. I'll tell you about that later.
Are congratulations in order?
Yes.
I see you're the right kind of guy! Would you mind doing another small job for me? Get it done and I'll give you my Black Kite. A great piece, and the punch it packs!
But what am I supposed to do?

There's this one guy who dug in at the swamp. My boys saw him rushing from the village over hedge and ditch. He must have seen something that knocked a few screws loose in his head. Now he's shooting anyone who comes in sight. You've got to find out what it was he saw, 'cause our people are too afraid to go into the village.
No, not this time.
Well, whatever.
Here's the flash drive I got from the crazy guy.
Hey, thanks, stalker! Take this artifact - you've earned it.
Got any ammo for it?
Just what's in the magazine. Sorry, that's all I got. Go see Skinflint, he might have some.
Thank you. The 'Cactus' will come in handy.
I'll try.
Good luck, then. Don't forget - there's an old minefield, but with the help of a few good old bolts you can go around any mine.
So, what did you learn? What happened to that psycho?
Here's a flash drive - I got it from the crazy guy.
What, already?
What do you want to know?
What's up, stalker! What you got?
I've got business to discuss. Can you show me the way to your boss?
You want Lukash - he's our leader. Go to the main building.
I see you managed alright. Give the documents to Lukash.
Go to Lukash and make your report, then we'll talk, alight?
OK.
Man, you're in the Freedom base! Relax, make yourself at home!
I see.

Behave, OK? Got it? Try fooling around and you'll be sorry. We had a slow-witted one here once; he pissed everyone off so bad that we made him take a hike on the minefield - naked. You should have heard Skinflint cursing when that dude's arm fell square on his head! That was something special... yeah... So, you got the idea?
Gotcha.
Good man! Dismissed.
Ah, a rookie... Come over a sec.
I don't get it.
What didn't you get? Oh, you haven't heard the story about the slow-witted ones, huh?
No, I haven't.
Alright, look. Think about it: these are lean times...
Meaning?
Well, that's easy! A hungry soldier is a bad soldier. And there's so many of us...
And?
Where would we get that much meat? And look, here you are!
Got it.
Where are you going? Stay! It's nice here... and we'll be having dinner tonight.
Nah, I'm not that appetizing.
What?!Shit, why didn't you tell me that before! We've just been wasting time. Get lost, buttface. And this time I'm dead serious...
OK see you!... Or not.
Okay, let's see what happens.

Then try stealth, man. You could quietly sneak in, remove the module, and disappear unnoticed. Don't look in the main building, but around the garages, in theory, the Repair Base should be located there.
Damn, the last thing I need is another skirmish with the military.

Yeah, I do! Well, you're aware that the military are now deployed at the Agroprom Institute. They're not just based there, they also act as a service depot for BTRs in the territory. They'd certainly have a large range of spare parts for quick replacement in the field. Try to search for them there, if they don't have any, then you definitely won't find them anywhere else.
Do you know where we can find some?
Good question, man. Let me think. So... among other things, BTRs are used to reinforce bases and patrol the Zone. Oh, look, it seems we have an option!
Where can we get another one?
That sucks, man. Most likely a faulty processor. I suppose we'll need to replace the control module.
Something like CPU_0000 error FAULT.
Hmm, yes? What was the error message?
Yep. It started, and can be driven, but it looks like the on-board computer is faulty.
What, again?
Well Screw, we still have one problem.
Okay, I'll try anything at once.
Well, just make three trips. You'll manage.
Dammit. I have to drag all this to the BTR.
Well, here it is. But, that's not all you need. besides the battery, you'll need a repair kit and a can of gasoline. All very heavy of course, but what can you do, it's everything you need.
Hi, I've come for the battery.
Okay, I'll take rest until then. I'm tired from searching the Garbage.
Well, about six hours, I think. Go for a walk for a while and get some fresh air, or if you want - get some sleep, or even have a few drinks with the guys. then return and I'll give it to you.
How long will it take?

So, let's see... yes, it's suitable. The plates are in good condition, there's no electrolyte, but it doesn't matter, I have acid, I'll rinse it out then refill it. Then I can charge it - so it can be used.
Here you are.
Great man, give it here, let me check it out.
Screw, I found a battery.
I see, do you mean the Garbage? Well, it's not the first time I walked through there.

Unfortunately I don't, I put the last one I had in a buggy. But it's not a problem finding one, there are a lot of them lying around the Zone. Hey, at a guess, search in the landfills. There are many vehicles buried there, and when they left, they didn't remove the batteries, as they were just as radioactive as the machines themselves. Of course, they will be heavily irradiated, but will be suitable for our purposes. In general, scour the landfills, inspect all the machines, and if you find a battery - drag it back to me, I'll re-charge it and then you will be able to start the BTR.
Do you have one?

Well it's not a problem to deal with the damage, I'll give you a repair kit, so you can dolly it up a bit, enough to reach our base. I'll also give you a canister of gasoline. Listen man, about the battery... has it any charge left at all? If I remember correctly, they've been lying there a couple of weeks. Then, most likely, the batteries are fucked. They are a high-tech lithium-polymer battery, and they cannot survive with a charge less than the minimum threshold. Most likely, trying to recharge these batteries won't succeed. We can't get the same batteries, but at least the BTRs starting voltage is standard, we can use an ordinary lead-acid battery to start the system.
Is damaged, out of fuel and has a flat battery.
Oh really, you found one! I'm stunned man. So, what condition is it in, tell me.
Screw, I found a BTR, but I need help.
Okay, then I'm going.

Well... generally, judging by the intercepted chatter while they were trying to escape, the BTRs could very well be badly damaged, so be aware. So, when you get there, see how badly damaged it is, and if you can't drive it, then come back to me - we'll think of something together about what can be done.
That's clear, what else do I need to know?

Well, generally you should find one of the three BTRs first, there may even be some traces of them left. The Chinook, as I understand it, crashed as it flew away and is lying somewhere in the Dead City, unless of course it fell into an anomalous field in the country. Therefore, you need to search there, look - if you are lucky, the key survived the crash, it's shock-resistant and waterproof.
Yeah, now I just have to find the commander's key.

Well, we've all listened to the intercepted chatter of the expedition during its demise, in short, those who survived tried to evacuate by helicopter - a Chinook heavy transport, but it didn't depart from there. It seems, it had the commander of one of the BTRs on board, so he had to have a key. Well, in short, the key is, a small wireless transmitter, it sends a special encoded radio signal. When a person with this device approaches the BTR, a signal is sent, and the hatches are unlocked automatically.
How do I drive it? Where do I get a key?

Yes, that's some harsh crap you signed up for, man. These BTRs that Lukash has probably already told you about, generally have a completely automated control system. They automated everything they could, including access to the vehicle, you understand. You might find this a little banal - but you won't be able to get inside. It seals hermetically, the armour is thick and dense, and by the way, it can even withstand an emission, and if the hatch is closed, it's only possible to get in using a blowtorch to cut through the armour, and that could take a few days. Well, that's if you haven't got a key of course.
Well yes, but he told to consult you first.
Oh, all right, did you agree to get it?
Hi, Screw! Listen, Lukash asked me to get a BTR...
Oh, Marked One! A gift, man!
Look, you still want some vodka?
Screw, are you busy?
Listen, would you happen to know...
You got something that's broken, man?
Broken?
Aha, you're not here to ask for my help? Whew! I'm getting sick and tired of that. Soon as something breaks, they run to me and start whining about it.
And who are you?
I'm a mechanic. A Mr-Fix-It of sorts... I repair guns and whatever else you bring me. Right now, I'm working on these cars.
How's it going?
Pf-ft! Nothing but rubbish. I'm totally beat. Listen, you got any vodka on you? I'd, umm... you... want a nice scope? The best optics there is!
No.
It's your loss. If you have some - come in, don't be a stranger.
OK.
Here, take it.
Well, thanks! How nice of you. Now I'll have something to help me relax later on.
Good luck.
Don't distract me, I'm thinking...
No way, did you really bring vodka?
What is it?
Here's a tricky question - where do I go for things like artifacts and weapons?
You come to me, with money. Or go to the village and get them for free, but the risks are much higher.
The village?
The village. It's full of anomalies - rookies stumble on them all the time. Our guys just left to go there, you can join them if you want.
Got it.
What good things did you bring me?
What will you be needing?
Nothing... just looking around.
You should do something useful instead. Specially as I've got something you might be interested in... Want to earn, huh?
Interesting...

I can give you a Crystal if you do me one particular favor. A nasty situation has developed... Lately, no one has been bringing any artifacts from the village - they are too scared. They say bloodsuckers have settled in there. These days, I can't even send anyone - in fact, I'm that close of asking Duty for help!
Go on.
A couple of guys went to the village and didn't come back, and the other three are just sitting there on the outskirts. If you destroy the bloodsuckers, I'll give you a Crystal. What do you say?
Not right now.
Hey, it's your call... Sooner or later someone will clear them off. Meanwhile, Crystal is rare and rather expensive, too.
I'll do it.
Oh, that's swell. If you find more stuff like this, bring it over - I'll pay a good price.
And?
They're sitting there, looking around...
If you help them in their hunt, I'll give you an artifact called Crystal. So, what do you say?
We had a chat and then went on a walk across the village trying to catch some mutant...
And? Cut to the chase already!

We took down some kind of beast, but the guys went down, too. Right as we came to the water tower, they all grabbed their heads, and I had blood in my eyes, too... That shit bucket affects your brain. I killed the thing, but it was too late to help the guys.
That blows. Murk was a skilled stalker. Damn shame. Well, take this artifact for helping the boys.
Well, guys went hunting and I returned here...
I see.
Can I stock up on some equipment here?
For a fixed price, anything is possible.
I've already dealt with them.
Damn, stalker! You're as explosive as diarrhoea! OK, a deal is a deal, here's your Crystal.
So, how did the hunting go?
I killed the monsters.
How tough was it?
Average.
Hmm, interesting... All kind of gunk is spreading from the centre of the Zone - but where does it come from?.. OK, take this for your troubles.
But I asked you to zap those bloodsuckers in the village!
I changed my mind.
No problem. Of course, in that case there will be no reward.
Fine with me.
I'll try.
Uh-huh, so, you didn't settle that little problem... Therefore, I'll keep the artifact to myself.
No arguments from me.
People have been saying you took care of these bloodsuckers in the village. Is that true?
That's right.
Was it tough?
Average.
Hmm, interesting... All kind of gunk is spreading from the centre of the Zone - but where does it come from?.. OK, take this for your troubles.
So, what have you brought with you?
Is there a cook around here?
Sure is, how could we do without one! What the heck do you need him for, anyway?
Well, I need a little bit of food.
He's in his kitchen. Usually, he sits there and mutters.
Mutters?
What did you expect? A drunk is a drunk. If he couldn't cook, we'd get rid of him a long time ago. He's in the kitchen. I'll tell you how to get there.
Thanks for the information.
No problem.
Who's the boss here?
And what's your business?
I've got information for him.
Lukash is our leader. Go to the main building.
Got it. Thanks.
Same to you. What brings you here?
Who's the boss around here? I've got business to discuss with him.
Lukash is our leader, you can find him in the main building. But as you enter, make sure to put your piece away - unless you wanna get shot for nothing.
What for?
We had some shit happen - once a killer got this close to dropping Lukash. We stopped taking any risks after that.
Got it.
OK, you can go.
So-so. Keep out, don't bother me.
Greetings.
Halt! Who goes there?!
South African swallow!
Ha-ha! Correct! You can pass.
What's this swamp nearby?

A real radioactive puddle. Better not touch it, or you'll get enough rads to make your navel button unwind. There's a character in the middle of it, doesn't let anyone come close. Well, I can feel for him: who'd want to mix with idiots? 'Cause a normal person would definitely stay away from there.
Who is that guy, anyway?
Hell knows. They say he's one of our folks that's been to the village.
What village?
Well, there is one little hamlet nearby. Full of mutants and anomalies. I haven't been there yet - I only came to this base just recently. Ask Max - he's been here a hundred years.
Listen, where can I stock up on some ammo? Rostok is kind of a long walk from here, I don't feel like going there.
Go to the main building and you'll find it on the first floor.
What's up, rambling man? Looking to drop in at our place, huh?
Something like that.
How about joining us, eh?
How about not. I'm here on business.
C'mon, join us. It's a lot of fun.
I'll think about it.
Talking horse?
Off target.
Battleship sunk. Shit, stop tricking me! Got anything else?
Hit me.
Twenty-one. Damn, got me again! You're a slick one. OK, so you dunno the password, do you?
Will you tell me?
Yeah, right.
C'mon, please let me in. I can't spend the night in the fields, can I?
Why not - the weather is fine, almost like summer. Well, alright, if you pass the test - you can go, if not - get lost.
The test?
Sure. Three things every real man has to know.
I'm not scared. Go ahead.
OK, the easiest one first. Ready? Alright, what is Pamela Anderson's bra size?
You're a real idiot. Go fly a kite!
Crap.
You're a real idiot. Go fly a kite!
36 DD.
Good job! I can tell you're the right kind of man!
Yep, I am.
A bit more difficult now! OK... What's the round capacity of a cartridge that goes into the Russian Bison submachine gun ?
Twenty-five.
Sixty-eight.
Fifty-four.
Awesome! I'm liking you more and more... don't get me wrong, not that way!
Sure.
On to the third one! What's the flight speed of a South African swallow ?
A South African what?!
Swallow!
How am I supposed to know that?! Do you even have the answer?
Of course not. That's the thing, I can't seem to solve that puzzle... Well, OK, you can pass.
Whoa, man!
OK, want to try again? Alright. Question: what is Dotty Dangerfield's bra size?
You're a pushy sort! I repeat: what's the capacity of the magazine that goes into the Russian Bison SMG?
I've thought about it... Still, you have cool guys here. I want to join Freedom!

He-he... Well, Marked One, I'm glad you're with us. We need good men like you. On this occasion, I allow you access to our arsenal. Talk to the guard, he'll let you in. Skinflint will give you a key to the door.

Great job, Marked One! take this... a reward for the "snitch". I invite you to relax in our territory, and when you want our help, you can count on it. By the way, do you want to join Freedom?\n\n(NOTE: Joining the "Freedom" group cannot be undone, this action effectively cuts off the possibility of free access to the Bar and quests from the Duty commander.)
Yes, I want to join Freedom.
No thanks.
Excellent, Marked One. Congratulations, you're now one of us. On this occasion, I allow you access to our arsenal. Talk to the guard, he'll let go.
Thank you.
By the way, there is one more thing that I would like to entrust to you. Not tired yet?
Well, Marked one, you have made me very angry. You're either with us or against us, okay? I usually don't forgive this... But I'm willing to forget about it, if you perform another job for me...
I've heard that you're a good mechanic, you can fix anything! Do you have a set of wheels for me? I'm tired of walking around the Zone.
Screw, you asked for vodka?
Screw, are you busy?
Sorry, I meant to ask...
Oh, Marked One, gifts!

We're not like Duty, we don't go on long raids for dog tails. We have a Barrier close to here. We don't need to carry our equipment with us all the time, so we can use the cars for different purposes. Sometimes the stalkers themselves buy a car. Damn, If someone turned off the Scorcher - I could open a Car Service Centre here. If you have the money - I can sell you one. And mind you - I want the money in advance.
I'll think about, show me what you got.
No, it's better to walk, and get some fresh air.
Sorry, I changed my mind, I won't take the car.
I'm sorry too, buddy, but you ordered the car. I'm keeping the money, so I don't get burnt.
Oh, okay, let's have a drink or something.
Come on, tell me where to find it.
Well then, take our "workhorse", it's right at the entrance. I'll cost you 10000 roubles. I'll re-build another one later.
Well, let's see what kind of design engineer you are.
It's near the stalkers camp.
Yeah ... Yeah ... Moskvich. 20,000 and it's yours... In the bloodsucker's village... At the same time, you can hunt! He-he!
About the Moskvich. I'll take it!
Go to the Radar.
18000 roubles. Fuck knows what condition it's in, but the car is yours. It's at the "Monolith" checkpoint. So it should be fully serviced.
Can I buy it on credit? No? Well, okay...
Do you know anyone here would need dynamite?
Aren't you the goose who was getting the dynamite for Wolf before be was killed?
No, not me.
I'm not a goose. I brought some fucking dynamite.
Well and good, all the same we already have some.
Give it here! A second box of explosives is always handy.
So long.
Okay, take the dynamite!
Lukash said that I can get the key to the arsenal.
Yes, I know. Here you are. Glad to see you in our ranks!
Thank you.
I'm looking for a stalker named Owl. I was told he went to the Army Warehouses, and may be at the Freedom base.
Yes, he was here. I'm glad you're looking for him.
Why is that?

Because he went along to the Radar with a group led by my best scout, Mikluha, and I haven't heard from them for over a week. I need someone to check whether Mikluha and his guys are still alive, and if not, then at least give them a decent burial - he was my best friend. At the same time, you'll find Owl there. Well, what do you say?
Okay, I'll check it out.
No, I don't want to go!
Yes, he was here. He headed to Radar, talked about some secret underground. Don't know, what he meant.
Thanks.
You seem sad.
What's there to be happy about? A good man is gone, my best scout.
What happened to him?

He went to the Radar with a group of guys and I haven't heard back from them. Listen, Marked One, do you want to earn some additional money? Could you look for the guys? I'll be indebted to you. Well, what do you say?
Okay, I'll check it out.
No, I don't want to go!
I found Mikluha and his guys.
What happened to them?
They asked me to say hello. They are alive and well.
Why the heck didn't they keep in touch?
They were being held by some kind of unusual creature. I had to intervene once again.
Well, they lost their compass somewhere and their PDAs burnt out. I showed them the way out.
Are you drunk? What the fuck are you talking about? Go sleep it off! You probably didn't go anywhere, just sat around drinking booze. You're free to go!
Yes, anything can happen to our brothers in the Zone... Take this, for your effort:
Listen, I took this from something I killed while rescuing your guys. Are you interested?
Holy shit! Give it to me, and in exchange, I'll tell you how to get into the old underground railway system. Okay?
Deal.
Silence... Silence... It's everywhere, it's everywhere, this silence...
Are you okay, buddy? Can you see me?
Emptiness... Emptiness in my head, and nowhere to go...
Hey, I'm here! Do you understand me?

You should not go there - to the village. I saw dead bodies lying at the water tower. I searched them and - one of them had a flash drive. I grabbed it - and then... Sound. The sound in my head. The sound that tore me apart! It grew louder and louder ... I ran, yes I ran. And then - again, the silence... It pushes and pushes me... Stronger and stronger every day... I don't know what's happening to me: I shout and I try to shoot everyone, I sit in a corner and I stare at one point... It's getting worse...
You want me to help you?

What can you do? No one can help me.. no one... you better save yourself, before it's too late. Run away from this place, this concentration of hatred, greed, betrayal and death! Run, while you're still human... before you become its offspring...
All in good time. Do you want me to take you to Yantar? There are people there who can help.

Sakharov? I don't know, maybe he can help me. Although it's unlikely. It's unlikely that he'll want to join me in listening to the silence... But, it's better to try to do something, before I finally go mad...\nOkay, take me there before it's too late.
Yes, let's go. Everything will be fine.
Again, this silence... It presses inside... I'm running out of strength to endure it...
Did Sakharov agree to help me?
He refused.
Let me guess - it's not his job description? I take that as a sign he's actually more Skinflintable than Sidorovich. I can see it... The silence is coming and coming...
Well, we can go to Dr. Marsh - he'll definitely help you.
have you ever seen him? In general, it seems this is just another myth of this cursed Zone.. Ahh! My head! It hurts! Arr! The fire in my head!
What happened?
No, not that, not that... It, it came to me again... No, I can't stand it, I CANNOT BEAR THIS AGAIN! Arr! Where is it? Where's my gun? Where is it?
Forget about the gun! Look at me! It's okay. Everything will be fine, believe me...
Man, I'm sorry I dragged you into this. There was no need for that. I'm sorry, I really can't tolerate this anymore... I walked all the way to the edge and I'm not afraid to take the last step...
STOP!
I've heard, that you can modify rifles.

Yeah, man, picking AK rifles sometimes. We in Freedom use NATO weapons mostly, but I still have my hands. I can get a "dovetail" on your AKM or attach a fancy custom kit on AK-102. In exchange for money, of course. Sadly, you have no rifles to work with, I'm in need for money. When you'll get a gun, bring it to me.

Yeah, man, picking AK rifles sometimes. We in Freedom use NATO weapons mostly, but I still have my hands. I can get a "dovetail" on your AKM or attach a fancy custom kit on AK-102. Actually, I can attach a rail on your current AK - what do you think? You'll be able to attach scopes to it, and I'll get some of your money. Just two grands for work and five hundreds for tail. Deal?

Yeah, man, picking AK rifles sometimes. We in Freedom use NATO weapons mostly, but I still have my hands. I can get a "dovetail" on your AKM or attach a fancy custom kit on AK-102. I see, you have one good AK-102. I can attach a telescopic butt to it and anatomic grip - you'll shoot with it as precisely as with Dragunov! Just three grands for work and two for kit itself. Deal?
Good, take money.
Oh, man, you're the best! One sec! Let's see... this belongs here... and what's that... I'm done! Take your gun.

Yeah, man, picking AK rifles sometimes. We in Freedom use NATO weapons mostly, but I still have my hands. I can get a "dovetail" on your AKM or attach a fancy custom kit on AK-102. In exchange for money, of course. Sadly, your rifle is already good, I'm in need for money. When you'll get a gun, bring it to me.
No money, man. See you later.
I got it. See ya.
